body:
Hi!


> Problem solved. I had an *image* called "rpiece" in the current working
> directory (and . in my search path). I'm not exactly sure what causes that
> to spawn all these bash shells


Makes sense - if the image had been created by rpiece and gets executed,
 the header lines listing all commands to generate the image will be
processed just as in a script.


Cheers,


Lars.
___
